result.execSummary:
The defendant Lauren L Leager was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

miscConds.notes:
*Pay all applicable costs and surcharges, victim/witness surcharge, the domestic violence surcharge and supervision fees as determined by the DOC. Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
*Defendant to pay all supervision fees as determined by the DOC.
*Restitution is set at ZERO.

*NO firearms; weapons.
*Court advised defendant of penalties for violating  the no contact order and due to this DV conviction she may never possess firearms or ammunition.
*NO violent contact with the victim rising to the level of probable cause for arrest.

*Mental Health Evaluation and take all prescribed medication, and/or any treatment deemed appropriate.
*Successfully complete Anger Management, and continued programming.
*Parenting Classes.
*Successfully complete any other counseling and/or treatment deemed appropriate.

*Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment including random urine screens.
*Maintain absolute sobriety.

timeConds.notes: *Time is stayed pending a review on 11/13/15 at 1:30pm.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Lauren L Leager

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Lauren L Leager in court.  Sarah McNutt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Probation Agent is in court.  Probation Status Review report filed and reviewed.  Defendant is compliant or mostly compliant with probation.  The remaining condition time is stayed.  Court found that further review is not needed.

Defendant Lauren L Leager in court with attorney Justin Singleton.  Elizabeth Longo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case has resolved.  Upon motion of the state, count 2 is ordered dismissed and read in for sentencing.
AS to count 1:    Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, and further advised that if not a United States citizen deportation is possible. Defendant examined as to plea, and entered a plea of guilty.  Court found defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived all constitutional rights. Plea questionnaire waiver of rights and addendum to plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulated to the criminal complaint as factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered into the record.  
Sentencing proceeded.    Statements by counsels and the defendant.  Defendant sentenced to serve 90 days in the House of Correction with credit for 1 day time served.  COURT STAYED THE SENTENCE and placed the defendant on probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 14 months.
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
-As a condition of probation, the Court ordered the defendant to serve 20 days in the House of Correction.  This time is stayed pending a review on 11-13-2015 at 1:30pm.
-Mental Health Evaluation and take ALL prescribed medication, and/or any treatment deemed appropriate.        
-Successfully complete Anger Management, and continued programming.  PARENTING CLASSES.
-Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment including random urine screens.
-Maintain absolute sobriety.
-Successfully complete any other counseling and/or treatment deemed appropriate.
-NO VIOLENT CONTACT with the victim rising to the level of probable cause for arrest.
-Defendant to pay all applicable costs and surcharges, victim/witness surcharge, the domestic violence surcharge, and supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
-Defendant to pay all supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.
-Obtain and maintain employment.
-No firearms; weapons.
-Restitution is set at ZERO.
Received and filed: Pretrial Sentence Credit, Memorandum of Conditions of Probation.  Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the no contact order and due to this DV conviction she may never possess firearms or ammunition.  Case adjourned to Branch 38.  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for November 13, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Final pre-trial scheduled for 08-06-2015 at 08:15 am.

Defendant Lauren L Leager in court with attorney Justin Singleton.  William T. Berens appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Parties in court regarding modification of the No Contact Order.  Statements to the Court by Angelina G.
Bail motion by defense argued and denied by the Court.  Court will not modify No Contact Order at this time.  Defense counsel requests adjournment for final pre-trial.  Court orders case adjourned for final pre-trial in Branch 4.  Parties are advised that EFFECTIVE August 3, 2015, this case will be assigned to JUDGE WAGNER, BRANCH 38, in Room 504 in the Courthouse.
Clerk:  jms

Notice Of Motion And Motion To Modify Bail And No Contact Order received and filed.
Clerk:  jms
Cash bail that was previously posted to remain.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Angelina G.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Court ordered arrest warrant withdrawn.  Recall issued.

Defendant Lauren L Leager in court with attorney Justin Singleton.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Flanagan, Branch 04.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to Defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Branch 04.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 2, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Arrest Warrant received from the D.A.'s office on filing date of Criminal Complaint.
